verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 1:2
verses.text: John Chrysostom,  archbishop of constantinople,  on the  second epistle of St.

verses.text: paul the apostle  to the  thessalonians.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:1
verses.text: Homily I.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:2
verses.text: Argument.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:3
verses.text: Having said in his former Epistle that "we pray night and day to see you, and that we could not forbear, but were left in Athens alone," and that "I sent Timothy" (from  Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:4
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:6
verses.text: ), by all these expressions he shows the desire which he had to come amongst them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:7
verses.text: When therefore he had perhaps not had time to go, and to perfect what was lacking in their faith, on this account he adds a second Epistle, filling up by his writings what was wanting of his presence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:8
verses.text: For that he did not depart, we may conjecture from hence: for he says in this Epistle, "We beseech you by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:9
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:10
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:11
verses.text: ) For in his first Epistle he said, "Concerning the times and the seasons ye have no need that aught be written unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:12
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:13
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:14
verses.text: ) So that if he had gone, there would have been no need of his writing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:15
verses.text: But since the question was deferred, on this account he adds this Epistle, as in his Epistle to Timothy he says, "They subvert the faith of some, saying that the Resurrection is already past" (from  Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:16
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:17
verses.text: ); that the faithful henceforth hoping for nothing great or splendid, might faint under their sufferings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:18
verses.text: For since that hope supported them, and did not allow them to yield to the present evils, the devil wishing to cut it off, as being a kind of anchor, when he was not able to persuade them that the things to come were false, went to work another way, and having suborned certain pestilential men, endeavored to deceive those who believed into a persuasion that those great and splendid things had received their fulfillment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:19
verses.text: Accordingly these men then said that the Resurrection was already past.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:20
verses.text: But now they said that the Judgment and the coming of Christ were at hand, that they might involve even Christ in a falsehood, and having pointed out to them that there is hereafter no retribution, nor judgment-seat, nor punishment and vengeance for those who had done them evil, they might both render these more bold, and those more dispirited.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:21
verses.text: And, what was worse than all, some attempted merely to report words as if they were said by Paul, but others even to forge Epistles as written by him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:22
verses.text: On this account, cutting off all access for them, he says, "Be not quickly shaken from your mind, nor yet be troubled, either by spirit, or by word, or by epistle as from us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:23
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:24
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:25
verses.text: ) "Neither by spirit," he says, glancing at the false prophets.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:26
verses.text: Whence then shall we know them, he says? For this very reason, he added, "The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand, which is the token in every Epistle: so I write.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:27
verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:28
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:29
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:31
verses.text: ) He does not here mean, that this is the token,—for it is probable that others also imitated this,—but that I write the salutation with mine own hand, as is the custom also now among us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:32
verses.text: For by the subscription the writings of those who send letters are made known.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:33
verses.text: But he comforts them, as being excessively pinched by their troubles; both praising them from their present state, and encouraging them from a prospect of the futurity, and from the punishment, and from the recompense of good things prepared for them; and he more clearly enlarges upon the topic, not indeed revealing the time itself, but showing the sign of the time, namely, Antichrist.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:34
verses.text: For a weak soul is then most fully assured, not when it merely hears, but when it learns something more particular.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:35
verses.text: And Christ too bestowed great care upon this point, and being seated on the Mount, He with great particularity discoursed to His disciples upon the Consummation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:36
verses.text: And wherefore? that there might be no room for those who introduce Antichrists and false Christs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:37
verses.text: And He Himself also gives many signs, one indeed, and that the most important, saying, when "the Gospel shall be preached to all nations" (from Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:38
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:39
verses.text: ), and another also, that they should not be deceived with respect to His coming.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:40
verses.text: "As the lightning" (ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:41
verses.text: ), He says, shall He come; not concealed in any corner, but shining everywhere.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:42
verses.text: It requires no one to point it out, so splendid will it be, even as the lightning needs no one to point it out.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:43
verses.text: And He has spoken in a certain place also concerning Antichrist, when He said, "I am come in My Father's name, and ye receive Me not: if another shall come in His own name, Him ye will receive".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:44
verses.text: (John v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:45
verses.text: ) And He said that those unspeakable calamities one after another were a sign of it, and that Elias must come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:46
verses.text: The Thessalonians indeed were then perplexed, but their perplexity has been profitable to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:47
verses.text: For not to them only, but to us also are these things useful, that we may be delivered from childish fables and from old women's fooleries.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:48
verses.text: And have you not often heard, when you were children, persons talking much even about the name of Antichrist, and about his bending the knee? For the devil scatters these things in our minds, whilst yet tender, that the doctrine may grow up with us, and that he may be able to deceive us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:49
verses.text: Paul therefore, in speaking of Antichrist, would not have passed over these things if they had been profitable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:50
verses.text: Let us not therefore enquire into these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:51
verses.text: For he will not come so bending his knees, but "exalting himself against all that is called God, or that is worshiped; so that he sitteth in the temple of God, setting himself forth as God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:52
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:53
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:54
verses.text: ) For as the devil fell by pride, so he who is wrought upon by him is anointed unto pride.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:55
verses.text: Wherefore, I beseech you, let us all be earnest to be far removed from this affection, that we may not fall into his condemnation, that we may not subject ourselves to the same punishment, that we may not partake of the vengeance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:56
verses.text: "Not a novice," he says, "lest being puffed up he fall into the condemnation of the devil".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:57
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:58
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:59
verses.text: ) He who is puffed up therefore, suffers the same punishment with the devil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:60
verses.text: "For the beginning of pride is not to know the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:61
verses.text: (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:62
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:64
verses.text: ) Pride is the beginning of sin, the first impulse and movement toward evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:65
verses.text: Perhaps indeed it is both the root and the foundation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:66
verses.text: For "the beginning" means either the first impulse towards evil, or the grounding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:67
verses.text: As if one should say, the beginning of chastity is to abstain from the sight of an improper object, that is the first impulse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:68
verses.text: But if we should say, the beginning of chastity is fasting, that is the foundation and establishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:69
verses.text: So also pride is the beginning of sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:70
verses.text: For every sin begins from it, and is maintained by it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:71
verses.text: For that, whatever good things we do, this vice suffers them not to remain and not fall away, but is as a certain root not letting them abide unshaken, is manifest from hence: see what things the Pharisee did, but they profited him nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:72
verses.text: For he did not extirpate the root, but it corrupted all his performances, because the root remained.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:73
verses.text: From pride springs contempt of the poor, desire of riches, the love of power, the longing for much glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:74
verses.text: Such an one is prompt to revenge an insult.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:75
verses.text: For he who is proud cannot bear to be insulted even by his superiors, much less by his inferiors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:76
verses.text: But he who cannot bear to be insulted cannot bear either to suffer any ill.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:77
verses.text: See how pride is the beginning of sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:78
verses.text: But how is it the beginning of pride, not to know the Lord? Justly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:79
verses.text: For he who knows God as he ought to know Him, he who knows that the Son of God humbled Himself so much, is not lifted up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:80
verses.text: But he who knows not these things, is lifted up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:81
verses.text: For pride anoints him unto arrogance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:82
verses.text: For tell me, whence is it that they who make war upon the Church say that they know God? Is it not from arrogance? See into what a precipice it plunges them, not to know the Lord! For if God loveth a contrite spirit (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:83
verses.text: li.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:84
verses.text: , etc.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:85
verses.text: ), He on the other hand "resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:86
verses.text: ( Pet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:87
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:88
verses.text: ) There is therefore no evil like pride.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:89
verses.text: It renders a man a demon, insolent, blasphemous, perjured, and makes him desirous of deaths and murders.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:90
verses.text: The proud man always lives in troubles, is always angry, always unhappy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:91
verses.text: There is nothing which can satiate his passion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:92
verses.text: If he should see the king stooping down to him, and prostrating himself, he is not satisfied, but is the more inflamed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:93
verses.text: For as the lovers of money, the more they receive, want so much the more, so also the proud, the more honor they enjoy, the more they desire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:94
verses.text: For their passion is increased; for a passion it is, and a passion knows not limit, but then stops when it has slain its possessor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:95
verses.text: Do you not see that drunkards are always thirsty? for it is a passion, not the desire of nature, but some perverted disease.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:96
verses.text: Do you not see how those who are affected with bulimy, as it is called, are always hungry? For it is a passion, as the children of the physicians say, already exceeding the bounds of nature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:97
verses.text: The busy-bodies, and the over-curious, whatever they have learnt, do not stop.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:98
verses.text: For it is a passion, and has no limit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:99
verses.text: (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:100
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:101
verses.text: ) Again, they who delight in fornication, they too cannot desist.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:102
verses.text: "To a fornicator," it is said, "all bread is sweet".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:103
verses.text: He will not cease, till he is devoured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:104
verses.text: For it is a passion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:105
verses.text: But they are indeed passions, not however incurable, but admitting of cure, and much more than bodily affections.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:106
verses.text: For if we will, we can extinguish them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:107
verses.text: How then can a man extinguish pride? By knowing God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:108
verses.text: For if it arises from not knowing God, if we know Him, all pride is banished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:109
verses.text: Think of Hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:110
verses.text: Think of those who are much better than yourself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:111
verses.text: Think of your sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:112
verses.text: Think for how many things you deserve punishment from God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:113
verses.text: If you think of these, you will soon bring down your proud mind, you will soon bend it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:114
verses.text: But can you not do these things? are you too weak? Consider things present, human nature itself, the nothingness of man! When thou seest a dead body carried through the market-place, orphan children following it, a widow beating her breast, servants bewailing, friends looking dejected, reflect upon the nothingness of things present, and that they differ not from a shadow, or a dream.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:115
verses.text: Does this not suit you? Think of those who are very rich, who perish anyhow in war; look round on the houses, that belonged to the great and illustrious, and are now leveled to the ground.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:116
verses.text: Consider how mighty they were, and now not even a memorial of them is left.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:117
verses.text: For, if you will, every day you may find examples of these things—the successions of rulers,—the confiscations of rich men's goods.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:118
verses.text: "Many tyrants have sat upon the ground—and he who was never thought on, has worn a diadem".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:119
verses.text: (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:120
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:121
verses.text: ) Do not these things happen every day? Do not our affairs resemble a kind of wheel? Read, if you will, both our own (books), and those without: for they also abound in such examples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:122
verses.text: If you despise ours, and this from pride; if you admire the works of philosophers, go even to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:123
verses.text: They will instruct thee, relating ancient calamities, as will poets, and orators, and sophists, and all historians.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:124
verses.text: From every side, if you will, you may find examples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:125
verses.text: But if you will none of these things, reflect upon our very nature, of what it consists, and wherein it ends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:126
verses.text: Consider, when you sleep, of what worth are you? Will not even a little beast be able to destroy thee? For often a little animal falling from the roof has deprived many persons of sight, or has been the cause of some other danger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:127
verses.text: But what? art thou not less than all beasts? But what sayest thou? that thou excellest in reason? But behold, thou hast not reason: for pride is a sign of the want of reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:128
verses.text: And for what, tell me, art thou high-minded after all? Is it upon the good constitution of thy body? But the prize of victory here is with the irrational creatures; this is possessed also by robbers and murderers, and violators of the tombs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:129
verses.text: But art thou proud of thine understanding? It is no proof of understanding to be proud.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:130
verses.text: By this then first thou deprivest thyself of becoming intelligent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:131
verses.text: Let us bring down our high thoughts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:132
verses.text: Let us be moderate, and lowly, and gentle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:133
verses.text: For such even Christ has pronounced blessed above all, saying, "Blessed are the poor in spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:134
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:135
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:136
verses.text: ) And again, He cried, saying, "Learn of Me, for I am meek and lowly in heart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:137
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:138
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:139
verses.text: ) For this reason He washed the feet of His disciples, affording us an example of humility.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 2:140
verses.text: From all these things let us gain profit, that we may be able to obtain the blessings promised to those who love Him, by the grace and lovingkindness, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:1
verses.text: Homily II.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:2
verses.text: Thessalonians i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:3
verses.text: ,  "Paul, and Silvanus, and Timothy, unto the Church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:4
verses.text: The greater part of men do and devise all things with a view to ingratiate themselves with rulers, and with those who are greater than themselves; and they account it a great thing, and think themselves happy, if they can obtain that object.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:5
verses.text: But if to obtain favor with men is so great an advantage, how great must it be to find favor with God? On this account he always thus prefaces his Epistle, and invokes this upon them, knowing that if this be granted, there will be nothing afterwards grievous, but whatever troubles there may be, all will be done away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:6
verses.text: And that you may learn this, Joseph was a slave a young man, inexperienced, unformed, and suddenly the direction of a house was committed to his hands, and he had to render an account to an Egyptian master.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:7
verses.text: And you know how prone to anger and unforgiving that people is, and when authority and power is added, their rage is greater, being inflamed by power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:8
verses.text: And this too is manifest from what he did afterwards.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:9
verses.text: For when the mistress made accusation, he bore with it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:10
verses.text: And yet it was not the part of those who held the garment, but of him who was stripped, to have suffered violence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:11
verses.text: For he ought to have said, If he had heard that thou didst raise thy voice, as thou sayest, he would have fled, and if he had been guilty, he would not have waited for the coming of his master.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:12
verses.text: But nevertheless he took nothing of this sort into consideration, but unreasonably giving way altogether to anger, he cast him into prison.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:13
verses.text: So thoughtless a person was he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:14
verses.text: And yet even from other things he might have conjectured the good disposition and the intelligence of the man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:15
verses.text: But nevertheless, because he was very unreasonable, he never considered any such thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:16
verses.text: He therefore who had to do with such a harsh master, and who was intrusted with the administration of his whole house, being a stranger, and solitary, and inexperienced; when God shed abundant grace upon him, passed through all, as if his temptations had not even existed, both the false accusation of his mistress, and the danger of death, and the prison, and at last came to the royal throne.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:17
verses.text: This blessed man therefore saw how great is the grace of God, and on this account he invokes it upon them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:18
verses.text: And another thing also he effects, wishing to render them well-disposed to the remaining part of the Epistle; that, though he should reprove and rebuke them, they might not break away from him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:19
verses.text: For this reason he reminds them before all things of the grace of God, mollifying their hearts, that, even if there be affliction, being reminded of the grace by which they were saved from the greater evil, they may not despair at the less, but may thence derive consolation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:20
verses.text: As also elsewhere in an Epistle he has said, "For if, while we were enemies, we were reconciled to God through the death of His Son, much more, being reconciled, shall we be saved by His life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:21
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:22
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:23
verses.text: )  "Grace to you and peace," he says, "from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:24
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:25
verses.text: "We are bound to give thanks to God alway for you, brethren, even as it is meet".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:26
verses.text: Again a sign of great humility.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:27
verses.text: For he led them to reflect and consider, that if for our good actions others do not admire us first, but God, much more also ought we.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:28
verses.text: And in other respects too he raises up their spirits, because they suffer such things as are not worthy of tears and lamentations, but of thanksgiving to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:29
verses.text: But if Paul is thankful for the good of others, what will they suffer, who not only are not thankful, but even pine at it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:30
verses.text: "For that your faith groweth exceedingly, and the love of each one of you all toward one another aboundeth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:31
verses.text: And how, you say, can faith increase? That is when we suffer something dreadful for it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:32
verses.text: It is a great thing for it to be established, and not to be carried away by reasonings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:33
verses.text: But when the winds assail us, when the rains burst upon us, when a violent storm is raised on every side, and the waves succeed each other—then that we are not shaken, is a proof of no less than this, that it grows, and grows exceedingly, and becomes loftier.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:34
verses.text: For as in the case of the flood all the stony and lower parts are soon hidden, but as many things as are above, it reaches not them, so also the faith that is become lofty, is not drawn downwards.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:35
verses.text: For this reason he does not say "your faith groweth;" but "groweth exceedingly, and the love of each one of you all toward one another aboundeth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:36
verses.text: Seest thou how this contributes for the ease of affliction, to be in close guard together, and to adhere to one another? From this also arose much consolation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:37
verses.text: The love and faith, therefore, that is weak, afflictions shake, but that which is strong they render stronger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:38
verses.text: For a soul that is in grief, when it is weak, can add nothing to itself; but that which is strong doth it then most.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:39
verses.text: And observe their love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:40
verses.text: They did not love one indeed, and not love another, but it was equal on the part of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:41
verses.text: For this he has intimated, by saying, "of each one of you all toward one another".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:42
verses.text: For it was equally poised, as that of one body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:43
verses.text: Since even now we find love existing among many, but this love becoming the cause of division.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:44
verses.text: For when we are knit together in parties of two or three, and the two indeed, or three or four, are closely bound to one another, but draw themselves off from the rest, because they can have recourse to these, and in all things confide in these; this is the division of love—not love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:45
verses.text: For tell me, if the eye should bestow upon the hand the foresight which it has for the whole body, and withdrawing itself from the other members, should attend to that alone, would it not injure the whole? Assuredly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:46
verses.text: So also if we confine to one or two the love which ought to be extended to the whole Church of God, we injure both ourselves and them, and the whole.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:47
verses.text: For these things are not of love, but of division; schisms, and distracting rents.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:48
verses.text: Since even if I separate and take a member from the whole man, the part separated indeed is united in itself, is continuous, all compacted together, yet even so it is a separation, since it is not united to the rest of the body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:49
verses.text: For what advantage is it, that thou lovest a certain person exceedingly? It is a human love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:50
verses.text: But if it is not a human love, but thou lovest for God's sake, then love all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:51
verses.text: For so God hath commanded to love even our enemies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:52
verses.text: And if He hath commanded to love our enemies, how much more those who have never aggrieved us? But, sayest thou, I love, but not in that way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:53
verses.text: Rather, thou dost not love at all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:54
verses.text: For when thou accusest, when thou enviest, when thou layest snares, how dost thou love? "But," sayest thou, "I do none of these things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:55
verses.text: But when a man is ill spoken of, and thou dost not shut the mouth of the speaker, dost not disbelieve his sayings, dost not check him, of what love is this the sign? "And the love," he says, "of each one of you all toward one another aboundeth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:56
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:57
verses.text: "So that we ourselves glory in you in the Churches of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:58
verses.text: Indeed in the first Epistle he says, that all the Churches of Macedonia and Achaia resounded, having heard of their faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:59
verses.text: "So that we need not," he says, "to speak anything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:60
verses.text: For they themselves report concerning us what manner of entering in we had unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:61
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:62
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:63
verses.text: ) But here he says, "so that we glory".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:64
verses.text: What then is it that is said? There he says that they need not instruction from him, but here he has not said that we teach them, but "we glory," and are proud of you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:65
verses.text: If therefore we both give thanks to God for you, and glory among men, much more ought you to do so for your own good deeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:66
verses.text: For if your good actions are worthy of boasting from others, how are they worthy of lamentation from you? It is impossible to say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:67
verses.text: "So that we ourselves," he says, "glory in you in the Churches of God, for your patience and faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:68
verses.text: Here he shows that much time had elapsed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:69
verses.text: For patience is shown by much time, not in two or three days.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:70
verses.text: And he does not merely say patience.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:71
verses.text: It is the part of patience indeed properly not yet to enjoy the promised blessings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:72
verses.text: But here he speaks of a greater patience.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:73
verses.text: And of what sort is that? That which is shown in persecutions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:74
verses.text: "For your patience," he says, "and faith in all your persecutions and in the afflictions which ye endure".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:75
verses.text: For they were living with enemies who were continually endeavoring on every side to injure them, and they were manifesting a patience firm and immovable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:76
verses.text: Let all those blush who for the sake of the patronage of men pass over to other doctrines.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:77
verses.text: For whilst it was yet the beginning of the preaching, poor men who lived by their daily earnings took upon themselves enmities from rulers and the first men of the state, when there was nowhere king or governor who was a believer; and submitted to irreconcilable war, and not even so were unsettled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:78
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:79
verses.text: "Which is a manifest token of the righteous judgment of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:80
verses.text: See how he gathers comfort for them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:81
verses.text: He had said, We give thanks to God, he had said, We glory among men: these things indeed are honorable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:82
verses.text: But that which he most seeks for, who is in suffering, is, deliverance from evils, and vengeance upon those who are evil entreating them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:83
verses.text: For when the soul is weak, it most seeks for these things, for the philosophic soul does not even seek these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:84
verses.text: Why then does he say, "a token of the righteous Judgment of God"? Here he has glanced at the retribution on either side, both of those who do the ill, and of those who suffer it, as if he had said, that the justice of God may be shown when He crowns you indeed, but punishes them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:85
verses.text: At the same time also he comforts them, showing that from their own labors and toils they are crowned, and according to the proportion of righteousness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:86
verses.text: But he puts their part first.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:87
verses.text: For although a person even vehemently desires revenge, yet he first longs for reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:88
verses.text: For this reason he says,  "That ye may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which ye also suffer".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:89
verses.text: This then does not come to pass from the circumstance that those who injure them are more powerful than they, but because it is so that they must enter into the kingdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:90
verses.text: "For through many tribulations," he says, "we must enter into the kingdom of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:91
verses.text: (Acts xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:92
verses.text: )  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:94
verses.text: "If so be that it is a righteous thing with God to recompense affliction to them that afflict you, and to you that are afflicted rest with us at the revelation of the Lord Jesus from heaven with the Angels of His power".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:95
verses.text: The phrase "If so be that" here is put for "because," which we also use, in speaking of things that are quite evident and not to be denied; instead of saying, "Because it is exceedingly righteous".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:96
verses.text: "If so be," he says, "that it is a righteous thing" with God to punish these, he will certainly punish them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:97
verses.text: As if he had said, "If God cares for human affairs," "If God takes thought".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:98
verses.text: And he does not put it of his own opinion, but among things confessedly true; as if one said, "If God hates the wicked," that he may compel them to grant that He does hate them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:99
verses.text: For such sentences are above all indisputable, inasmuch as they also themselves know that it is just.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:100
verses.text: For if this is just with men, much more with God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:101
verses.text: "To recompense," he says, "affliction to them that afflict you, and to you that are afflicted rest".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:102
verses.text: What then? Is the retribution equal? By no means, but see by what follows how he shows that it is more severe, and the "rest" much greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:103
verses.text: Behold also another consolation, in that they have their partners in the afflictions, as partners also in the retribution.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:104
verses.text: He joins them in their crowns with those who had performed infinitely more and greater works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:105
verses.text: Then he adds also the period, and by the description leads their minds upward, all but opening heaven already by his word, and setting it before their eyes; and he places around Him the angelic host, both from the place and from the attendants amplifying the image, so that they may be refreshed a little.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:106
verses.text: "And to you that are afflicted rest with us," he says, "at the revelation of the Lord Jesus from heaven with the Angels of his power".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:107
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:108
verses.text: "In flaming fire rendering vengeance to them that know not God, and to them that obey not the Gospel of our Lord Jesus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:109
verses.text: If they that have not obeyed the Gospel suffer vengeance, what will not they suffer who besides their disobedience also afflict you? And see his intelligence; he says not here those who afflict you, but those "who obey not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:110
verses.text: So that although not on your account, yet on His own it is necessary to punish them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:111
verses.text: This then is said in order to full assurance, that it is altogether necessary for them to be punished: but what was said before, was said that they also might be honored, because they suffer these things on your account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:112
verses.text: The one causes them to believe concerning the punishment; the other to be pleased, because for the sake of what has been done to them they suffer these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:113
verses.text: All this was said to them, but it applies also to us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:114
verses.text: When therefore we are in affliction, let us consider these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:115
verses.text: Let us not rejoice at the punishment of others as being avenged, but as ourselves escaping from such punishment and vengeance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:116
verses.text: For what advantage is it to us when others are punished? Let us not, I beseech you, have such souls.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:117
verses.text: Let us be invited to virtue by the prospect of the kingdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:118
verses.text: For he indeed who is exceedingly virtuous is induced neither by fear nor by the prospect of the kingdom, but for Christ's sake alone, as was the case with Paul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:119
verses.text: Let us, however, even thus consider the blessings of the kingdom, the miseries of hell, and thus regulate and school ourselves; let us in this way bring ourselves to the things that are to be practiced.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:120
verses.text: When you see anything good and great in the present life, think of the kingdom, and you will consider it as nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:121
verses.text: When you see anything terrible, think of hell, and you will deride it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:122
verses.text: When you are possessed by carnal desire, think of the fire, think also of the pleasure of sin itself, that it is nothing worth, that it has not even pleasure in it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:123
verses.text: For if the fear of the laws that are enacted here has so great power as to withdraw us from wicked actions, how much more should the remembrance of things future, the vengeance that is immortal, the punishment that is everlasting? If the fear of an earthly king withdraws us from so many evils, how much more the fear of the King Eternal?  Whence then can we constantly have this fear? If we continually hearken to the Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:124
verses.text: For if the sight only of a dead body so depresses the mind, how much more must hell and the fire unquenchable, how much more the worm that never dieth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:125
verses.text: If we always think of hell, we shall not soon fall into it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:126
verses.text: For this reason God has threatened punishment; if it was not attended with great advantage to think of it, God would not have threatened it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:127
verses.text: But because the remembrance of it is able to work great good, for this reason He has put into our souls the terror of it, as a wholesome medicine.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:128
verses.text: Let us not then overlook the great advantage arising from it, but let us continually advert to it, at our dinners, at our suppers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:129
verses.text: For conversation about pleasant things profits the soul nothing, but renders it more languid, while that about things painful and melancholy cuts off all that is relaxed and dissolute in it, and converts it, and braces it when unnerved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:130
verses.text: He who converses of theaters and actors does not benefit the soul, but inflames it more, and renders it more careless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:131
verses.text: He who concerns himself and is busy in other men's matters, often even involves it in dangers by this curiosity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:132
verses.text: But he who converses about hell incurs no dangers, and renders it more sober.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:133
verses.text: But dost thou fear the offensiveness of such words? Hast thou then, if thou art silent, extinguished hell? or if thou speakest of it, hast thou kindled it? Whether thou speakest of it or not, the fire boils forth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:134
verses.text: Let it be continually spoken of, that thou mayest never fall into it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:135
verses.text: It is not possible that a soul anxious about hell should readily sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:136
verses.text: For hear the most excellent advice, "Remember," it says, "thy latter end" (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:137
verses.text: xxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:138
verses.text: ), and thou wilt not sin for ever.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:139
verses.text: A soul that is fearful of giving account cannot but be slow to transgression.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:140
verses.text: For fear being vigorous in the soul does not permit anything worldly to exist in it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:141
verses.text: For if discourse raised concerning hell so humbles and brings it low, does not the reflection constantly dwelling upon the soul purify it more than any fire?  Let us not remember the kingdom so much as hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:142
verses.text: For fear has more power than the promise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:143
verses.text: And I know that many would despise ten thousand blessings, if they were rid of the punishment, inasmuch as it is even now sufficient for me to escape vengeance, and not to be punished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:144
verses.text: No one of those who have hell before their eyes will fall into hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:145
verses.text: No one of those who despise hell will escape hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:146
verses.text: For as among us those who fear the judgment-seats will not be apprehended by them, but those who despise them are chiefly those who fall under them, so it is also in this case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:147
verses.text: If the Ninevites had not feared destruction, they would have been overthrown, but because they feared, they were not overthrown.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:148
verses.text: If in the time of Noah they had feared the deluge, they would not have been drowned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:149
verses.text: And if the Sodomites had feared they would not have been consumed by fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:150
verses.text: It is a great evil to despise a threat.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:151
verses.text: He who despises threatening will soon experience its reality in the execution of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:152
verses.text: Nothing is so profitable as to converse concerning hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:153
verses.text: It renders our souls purer than any silver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:154
verses.text: For hear the prophet saying, "Thy judgments are always before me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:155
verses.text: (From Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:156
verses.text: xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:157
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:158
verses.text: ) For although it pains the hearer, it benefits him very much.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:159
verses.text: For such indeed are all things that profit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:160
verses.text: For medicines too, and food, at first annoy the sick, and then do him good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:161
verses.text: And if we cannot bear the severity of words, it is manifest that we shall not be able to bear affliction in very deed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:162
verses.text: If no one endures a discourse concerning hell, it is evident, that if persecution came on, no one would ever stand firm against fire, against sword.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:163
verses.text: Let us exercise our ears not to be over soft and tender: for from this we shall come to endure even the things themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:164
verses.text: If we be habituated to hear of dreadful things, we shall be habituated also to endure dreadful things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:165
verses.text: But if we be so relaxed as not to endure even words, when shall we stand against things? Do you see how the blessed Paul despises all things here, and dangers one after another, as not even temptations? Wherefore? Because he had been in the practice of despising hell, for the sake of what was God's will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:166
verses.text: He thought even the experience of hell to be nothing for the sake of the love of Christ; while we do not even endure a discourse concerning it for our own advantage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:167
verses.text: Now therefore having heard a little, go your ways; but I beseech you if there is any love in you, constantly to revert to discourses concerning these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:168
verses.text: They can do you no harm, even if they should not benefit, but assuredly they will benefit you too.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:169
verses.text: For according to our discourses, the soul is qualified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:170
verses.text: For evil communications, he says, "corrupt good manners".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:171
verses.text: Therefore also good communications improve it; therefore also fearful discourses make it sober.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:172
verses.text: For the soul is a sort of wax.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:173
verses.text: For if you apply cold discourses, you harden and make it callous; but if fiery ones, you melt it; and having melted it, you form it to what you will, and engrave the royal image upon it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:174
verses.text: Let us therefore stop up our ears to discourses that are vain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:175
verses.text: It is no little evil; for from it arise all evils.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:176
verses.text: If our mind had been practiced to apply to divine discourses, it would not apply to others; and not applying to others, neither would it betake itself to evil actions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:177
verses.text: For words are the road to works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:178
verses.text: First we think, then we speak, then we act.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:179
verses.text: Many men, even when before sober, have often from disgraceful words gone on to disgraceful actions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:180
verses.text: For our soul is neither good nor evil by nature, but becomes both the one and the other from choice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:181
verses.text: As therefore the sail carries the ship wherever the wind may blow, or rather as the rudder moves the ship, if the wind be favorable, so also thought will sail without danger, if good words from a favorable quarter waft it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:182
verses.text: But if the contrary, often they will even overwhelm the reason.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:183
verses.text: For what winds are to ships, that discourses are to souls.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:184
verses.text: Wherever you will, you may move and turn it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:185
verses.text: For this reason one exhorting says, "Let thy whole discourse be in the law of the Most High".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:186
verses.text: (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:187
verses.text: xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:188
verses.text: ) Wherefore, I exhort you, when we receive children from the nurse, let us not accustom them to old wives' stories, but let them learn from their first youth that there is a Judgment, that there is a punishment; let it be infixed in their minds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:189
verses.text: This fear being rooted in them produces great good effects.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:190
verses.text: For a soul that has learnt from its first youth to be subdued by this expectation, will not soon shake off this fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:191
verses.text: But like a horse obedient to the bridle, having the thought of hell seated upon it, walking orderly, it will both speak and utter things profitable; and neither youth nor riches, nor an orphan state, nor any other thing, will be able to injure it, having its reason so firm and able to hold out against everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:192
verses.text: By these discourses let us regulate as well ourselves as our wives too, our servants, our children, our friends, and, if possible, our enemies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:193
verses.text: For with these discourses we are able to cut off the greater part of our sins, and it is better to dwell upon things grievous than upon things agreeable, and it is manifest from hence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:194
verses.text: For, tell me, if you should go into a house where a marriage is celebrated, for a season you are delighted at the spectacle, but afterwards having gone away, you pine with grief that you have not so much.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:195
verses.text: But if you enter the house of mourners, even though they are very rich, when you go away you will be rather refreshed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:196
verses.text: For there you have not conceived envy, but comfort and consolation in your poverty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:197
verses.text: You have seen by facts, that riches are no good, poverty no evil, but they are things indifferent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:198
verses.text: So also now, if you talk about luxury, you the more vex your soul, that is not able perhaps to be luxurious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:199
verses.text: But if you are speaking against luxury, and introduce discourse concerning hell, the thing will cheer you, and beget much pleasure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:200
verses.text: For when you consider that luxury will not be able to defend us at all against that fire, you will not seek after it; but if you reflect that it is wont to kindle it even more, you will not only not seek, but will turn from it and reject it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:201
verses.text: Let us not avoid discourses concerning hell, that we may avoid hell.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:202
verses.text: Let us not banish the remembrance of punishment, that we may escape punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:203
verses.text: If the rich man had reflected upon that fire, he would not have sinned; but because he never was mindful of it, therefore he fell into it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:204
verses.text: Tell me, O man, being about to stand before the Judgment-seat of Christ, dost thou speak of all things rather than of that? And when you have a matter before a judge, often only relating to words, neither day nor night, at no time or season dost thou talk of anything else, but always of that business, and when thou art about to give an account of thy whole life, and to submit to a trial, canst thou not bear even with others reminding thee of that Judgment? For this reason therefore all things are ruined and undone, because when we are about to stand before a human tribunal concerning matters of this life, we move everything, we solicit all men, we are constantly anxious about it, we do everything for the sake of it: but when we are about, after no long time, to come before the Judgment-seat of Christ, we do nothing either by ourselves, or by others; we do not entreat the Judge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:205
verses.text: And yet He grants to us a long season of forbearance, and does not snatch us away in the midst of our sins, but permits us to put them off, and that Goodness and Lovingkindness leaves nothing undone of all that belongs to Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:206
verses.text: But all is of no avail; on this account the punishment will be the heavier.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:207
verses.text: But God forbid it should be so! Wherefore, I beseech you, let us even if but now become watchful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:208
verses.text: Let us keep hell before our eyes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 3:209
verses.text: Let us consider that inexorable Account, that, thinking of those things, we may both avoid vice, and choose virtue, and may be able to obtain the blessings promised to those who love Him, by the grace and lovingkindness, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:1
verses.text: Homily III.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:2
verses.text: Thessalonians i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:3
verses.text: ,  "Who shall suffer punishment, even eternal destruction from the face of the Lord, and from the glory of His might, when He shall come to be glorified in His Saints, and to be marveled at in all them that believed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:4
verses.text: There are many men, who form good hopes not by abstaining from their sins, but by thinking that hell is not so terrible as it is said to be, but milder than what is threatened, and temporary, not eternal; and about this they philosophize much.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:5
verses.text: But I could show from many reasons, and conclude from the very expressions concerning hell, that it is not only not milder, but much more terrible than is threatened.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:6
verses.text: But I do not now intend to discourse concerning these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:7
verses.text: For the fear even from bare words is sufficient, though we do not fully unfold their meaning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:8
verses.text: But that it is not temporary, hear Paul now saying, concerning those who know not God, and who do not believe in the Gospel, that "they shall suffer punishment, even eternal destruction".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:9
verses.text: How then is that temporary which is everlasting? "From the face of the Lord," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:10
verses.text: What is this? He here wishes to say how easily it might be.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:11
verses.text: For since they were then much puffed up, there is no need, he says, of much trouble; it is enough that God comes and is seen, and all are involved in punishment and vengeance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:12
verses.text: His coming only to some indeed will be Light, but to others vengeance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:13
verses.text: "And from the glory of His might," he says, "when He shall come to be glorified in His Saints, and to be marveled at in all them that believed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:14
verses.text: Is God glorified? Yea, he says, in all the Saints.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:15
verses.text: How? For when they that puff so greatly see those who were scourged by them, who were despised, who were derided, even those now near to Him, it is His glory, or rather it is their glory, both theirs and His; His indeed, because He did not forsake them; theirs, because they were thought worthy of so great honor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:16
verses.text: For as it is His riches, that there are faithful men, so also it is His glory that there are those who are to enjoy His blessings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:17
verses.text: It is the glory of Him that is good, to have those to whom He may impart His beneficence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:18
verses.text: "And to be marveled at," he says, "in all them that believed," that is, "through them that believed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:19
verses.text: See here again, "in" is used for "through".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:20
verses.text: For through them He is shown to be admirable, when He brings to so much splendor those who were pitiable and wretched, and who had suffered unnumbered ills, and had believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:21
verses.text: His power is shown then; because although they seem to be deserted here, yet nevertheless they there enjoy great glory; then especially is shown all the glory and the power of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:22
verses.text: How?  "Because our testimony unto you was believed in that day".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:23
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:24
verses.text: "To which end also we pray always for you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:25
verses.text: That is, when those are brought into public view, who have suffered unnumbered ills, deigned to make them apostatize from the faith, and yet have not yielded, but have believed, God is glorified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:26
verses.text: Then is shown the glory of these men also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:27
verses.text: "Judge none blessed," it says, "before his death".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:28
verses.text: (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:29
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:30
verses.text: ) On this account he says, in that day will be shown those who believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:31
verses.text: "To which end also we pray," he says, "always for you, that our God may count you worthy of your calling, and fulfill every desire of goodness and every work of faith, with power".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:32
verses.text: "That He may count you," he says, "worthy of calling"; for they were not called.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:33
verses.text: Therefore he has added, "and fulfill every desire of goodness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:34
verses.text: Since he also who was clothed in filthy garments, was called, but did not abide in his calling, but for this reason was the more rejected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:35
verses.text: "Of the calling," namely that to the bride-chamber.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:36
verses.text: Since the five virgins also were called.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:37
verses.text: "Arise" it says, "the bridegroom cometh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:38
verses.text: (From Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:39
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:40
verses.text: ) And they prepared themselves, but did not enter in.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:41
verses.text: But he speaks of that other calling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:42
verses.text: Showing therefore what calling he is speaking of, he has added, "And fulfill every desire of goodness and every work of faith, with power".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:43
verses.text: This is the calling, he says, that we seek.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:44
verses.text: See how gently he takes them down.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:45
verses.text: For that they may not be rendered vain by the excess of commendation, as if they had done great deeds, and may not become slothful, he shows that something still is wanting to them, so long as they are in this life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:46
verses.text: Which also he said in his Epistle to the Hebrews.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:47
verses.text: "Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against sin".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:48
verses.text: (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:49
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:50
verses.text: ) "Unto all wellpleasing," he says, that is, His gratification, persuasion, full assurance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:51
verses.text: That is, that the persuasion of God may be fulfilled, that nothing may be wanting to you, that you may be so, as He wills.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:52
verses.text: "And every work of faith," he says, "with power".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:53
verses.text: What is this? The patient endurance of persecutions, that we may not faint, he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:54
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:55
verses.text: "That the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and ye in Him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:56
verses.text: He spoke there of glory, he speaks of it also here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:57
verses.text: He said, that they are glorified, so that they might even boast.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:58
verses.text: He said, what was much more, that they also glorify God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:59
verses.text: He said, that they will receive that glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:60
verses.text: But here too he means; For the Master being glorified, the servants also are glorified.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:61
verses.text: For those who glorify their Master, are much more glorified themselves, both by that very thing, and apart from it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:62
verses.text: For tribulation for the sake of Christ is glory, and that thing he everywhere calls glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:63
verses.text: And by how much the more we suffer anything dishonorable, so much the more illustrious we become.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:64
verses.text: Then again showing that this also itself is of God, he says, "according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ"; that is, this grace He Himself has given us, that He may be glorified in us, and that He may glorify us in Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:65
verses.text: How is He glorified in us? Because we prefer nothing before Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:66
verses.text: How are we glorified in Him? Because we have received power from Him, so that we do not at all yield to the evils that are brought upon us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:67
verses.text: For when temptation happens, at the same time God is glorified, and we too.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:68
verses.text: For they glorify Him, because He has so nerved us; they admire us, because we have rendered ourselves worthy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:69
verses.text: And all these things are done by the grace of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:70
verses.text: Chap.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:71
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:73
verses.text: "Now we beseech you, brethren, touching the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, and our gathering together unto Him; to the end that ye be not quickly shaken from your mind".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:74
verses.text: When the Resurrection will be, he has not said, but that it will not be now, he has said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:75
verses.text: "And our gathering together unto Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:76
verses.text: This also is no little matter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:77
verses.text: See how the exhortation also is again accompanied with commendation and encouragement, in that He and all the Saints will certainly appear with us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:78
verses.text: Here he is discoursing concerning the resurrection and our gathering together.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:79
verses.text: For these things will happen at the same time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:80
verses.text: He raises up their minds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:81
verses.text: "That ye be not quickly shaken," he says, "nor yet be troubled, either by spirit, or by word, or by epistle as from us, as that the day of the Lord is now present".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:82
verses.text: Here he seems to me to intimate that certain persons went about having forged an Epistle, as if from Paul, and showing this, said that the Day of the Lord is at hand, that thence they might lead many into error.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:83
verses.text: Therefore that they might not be deceived, Paul gives security by the things he writes, and says, "be not troubled, either by spirit or by word": and this is the meaning of what he says: Though any one having the spirit of prophecy should say this, believe it not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:84
verses.text: For when I was with you I told you these things, so that you ought not to change your persuasion from the things which you were taught.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:85
verses.text: Or thus, "by spirit": so he calls the false prophet, speaking what they spoke by an unclean spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:86
verses.text: For these men, willing the more to be believed, not only endeavored to deceive by persuasive words, (for this he shows, saying, "or by word,") but they also showed a forged letter, as from Paul, declaring the same thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:87
verses.text: Wherefore pointing out this also, he has added, "or by letter as from us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:88
verses.text: Having therefore secured them on every side, he thus sets forth his own doctrine, and says:  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:90
verses.text: "Let no man beguile you in any wise: for it will not be, except the falling away come first, and the man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition, he that opposeth and exalteth himself against all that is called God or that is worshiped; so that he sitteth in the temple of God, setting himself forth as God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:91
verses.text: Here he discourses concerning the Antichrist, and reveals great mysteries.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:92
verses.text: What is "the falling away?" He calls him Apostasy, as being about to destroy many, and make them fall away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:93
verses.text: So that if it were possible, He says, the very Elect should be offended.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:94
verses.text: (From Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:95
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:96
verses.text: ) And he calls him "the man of sin".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:97
verses.text: For he shall do numberless mischiefs, and shall cause others to do them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:98
verses.text: But he calls him "the son of perdition," because he is also to be destroyed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:99
verses.text: But who is he? Is it then Satan? By no means; but some man, that admits his fully working in him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:100
verses.text: For he is a man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:101
verses.text: "And exalteth himself against all that is called God or is worshiped".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:102
verses.text: For he will not introduce idolatry, but will be a kind of opponent to God; he will abolish all the gods, and will order men to worship him instead of God, and he will be seated in the temple of God, not that in Jerusalem only, but also in every Church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:103
verses.text: "Setting himself forth," he says; he does not say, saying it, but endeavoring to show it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:104
verses.text: For he will perform great works, and will show wonderful signs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:105
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:106
verses.text: "Remember ye not, that when I was yet with you, I told you these things?"  Seest thou that it is necessary continually to say the same things, and to enlarge upon them in the same words? For behold, they heard him saying these things when present, and again they had need to be reminded of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:107
verses.text: For as when they had heard concerning afflictions, "For verily," he says, "when we were with you, we told you beforehand that we are to suffer affliction" ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:108
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:109
verses.text: ); they nevertheless forgot it, and he confirms them again by letters; so also having heard concerning the Coming of Christ, they again needed letters to compose them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:110
verses.text: He therefore reminds them, showing that he speaks of nothing strange, but what he had always said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:111
verses.text: For as in the case of husbandmen, the seeds are indeed cast into the earth once for all, yet do not constantly remain, but require much preparation withal, and if they do not break up the earth, and cover over the seeds sown, they sow for the birds that gather grain; so we also, unless by constant remembrance we cover over what has been sown, have but cast it all into the air.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:112
verses.text: For both the devil carries it away, and our sloth destroys it, and the sun dries it up, and the rain washes it away, and the thorns choke it: so that it is not sufficient after once sowing it to depart, but there is need of much assiduity, driving off the birds, rooting up the thorns, filling up the stony ground with much earth, checking, and fencing off, and taking away everything injurious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:113
verses.text: But in the case of the earth all depends upon the husbandman, for it is a lifeless subject, and prepared only to be passive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:114
verses.text: But in the spiritual soil it is quite otherwise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:115
verses.text: All is not the teachers' part, but half at least, if not more, that of the disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:116
verses.text: It is our part indeed to cast the seed, but yours to do the things spoken for your recollection, by your works to show the fruits, to pull up the thorns by the roots.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:117
verses.text: For wealth truly is a thorn, bearing no fruit, both uncomely to the sight, and unpleasant for use, injuring those that meddle with it, not only not itself bearing fruit, but even hindering that which was shooting forth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:118
verses.text: Such is wealth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:119
verses.text: It not only does not bear eternal fruit but it even hinders those who wish to gain it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:120
verses.text: Thorns are the food of irrational camels; they are devoured and consumed by fire, being useful for nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:121
verses.text: Such also is wealth, useful for nothing, but to kindle the furnace, to light up The Day that burns as an oven, to nourish passions void of reason, revenge and anger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:122
verses.text: For such is also the camel that feeds on thorns.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:123
verses.text: For it is said by those who are acquainted with such things, that there is no animal so implacable, so sulky and revengeful, as a camel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:124
verses.text: Such is wealth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:125
verses.text: It nourishes the unreasonable passions of the soul but it pierces and wounds the rational, as is the case with thorns.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:126
verses.text: This plant is hard and rough, and grows up of itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:127
verses.text: Let us see how it grows up, that we may root it out.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:128
verses.text: It grows in places that are precipitous, stony and dry, where there is no moisture.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:129
verses.text: When therefore anyone is rough and precipitous, that is unmerciful, the thorn grows in him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:130
verses.text: But when the sons of husbandmen wish to root them up, they do it not with iron.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:131
verses.text: How then? Having set fire to it, they in that way extract all the bad quality of the land.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:132
