verses.text: For since it is not enough to cut away the upper part, whilst the root remains below, nor even to extirpate the root, (for it remains in the earth from its bad quality, and, as when some pestilence has assailed the body, there are still left the remains of it,) the fire from above, drawing up all that moisture of the thorns, like some poison, extracts it by means of the heat from the bowels of the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:133
verses.text: For as the cupping glass placed upon the part draws all the disorder to itself, so also the fire draws off all the base quality that was in the thorns, and makes the land pure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:134
verses.text: On what account then do I say these things? Because it behoves you to purge off all affection for riches.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:135
verses.text: With us also there is a fire that draws this bad quality from the soul; I mean that of the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:136
verses.text: This if we let work on them, we shall be able not only to dry up the thorns, but also the humor from them, since if they be deeply fixed, all is rendered vain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:137
verses.text: For mark, has a rich man entered here, or also a rich woman? She does not regard how she shall hear the oracles of God, but how she shall make a show, how she shall sit with pomp, how with much glory, how she shall surpass all other women in the costliness of her garments, and render herself more dignified both by her dress, and look, and gait.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:138
verses.text: And all her care and concern is, Did such a woman see me? did she admire me? Is my beauty handsomely set off? so that her garments may not rot, nor be rent; and about this is all her care.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:139
verses.text: In like manner also the rich man enters, meaning to exhibit himself to the poor man, and to strike him with awe by the garments which are about him, and by the number of his slaves, who also stand round, driving off the crowd.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:140
verses.text: But he from his great pride does not condescend even to do this but considers it a work so unworthy of a gentleman, that although excessively puffed up, he cannot bear to do it, but commits it to his slaves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:141
verses.text: For to do this requires truly servile and impudent manners.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:142
verses.text: Then when he is seated, the cares of his house immediately intrude themselves, distracting him on every side.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:143
verses.text: The pride that possesses his soul overflows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:144
verses.text: He thinks that he does a favor both to us, and to the people, and perhaps even to God, because he has entered into the house of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:145
verses.text: But he who is thus inflamed, how shall he ever be cured?  Tell me then, if any one should go to the shop of a physician, and not ask a favor of the physician, but think that he was doing him a favor, and declining to request a medicine for his wound, should concern himself about his garments; would he go away having received any benefit? I think not indeed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:146
verses.text: But, with your leave, I will tell you the cause of all these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:147
verses.text: They think when they enter in here, that they enter into our presence, they think that what they hear they hear from us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:148
verses.text: They do not lay to heart, they do not consider, that they are entering into the presence of God, that it is He who addresses them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:149
verses.text: For when the Reader standing up says, "Thus saith the Lord," and the Deacon stands and imposes silence on all, he does not say this as doing honor to the Reader, but to Him who speaks to all through him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:150
verses.text: If they knew that it was God who through His prophet speaks these things, they would cast away all their pride.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:151
verses.text: For if when rulers are addressing them, they do not allow their minds to wander, much less would they, when God is speaking.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:152
verses.text: We are ministers, beloved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:153
verses.text: We speak not our own things, but the things of God, letters coming from heaven are every day read.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:154
verses.text: Tell me then, I beseech you, if now, when we are all present some one entered, having a golden girdle, and drawing himself up, and with an air of consequence said that he was sent by the king that is on the earth, and that he brought letters to the whole city concerning matters of importance; would you not then be all turned towards him? Would you not, without any command from a deacon, observe a profound silence? Truly I think so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:155
verses.text: For I have often heard letters from kings read here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:156
verses.text: Then if any one comes from a king, you all attend; and does a Prophet come from God, and speak from heaven, and no one attend? Or do you not believe that these things are messages from God? These are letters sent from God; therefore let us enter with becoming reverence into the Churches, and let us hearken with fear to the things here said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:157
verses.text: What do I come in for, you say, if I do not hear some one discoursing? This is the ruin and destruction of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:158
verses.text: For what need of a person to discourse? This necessity arises from our sloth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:159
verses.text: Wherefore any necessity for a homily? All things are clear and open that are in the divine Scriptures; the necessary things are all plain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:160
verses.text: But because ye are hearers for pleasure's sake, for that reason also you seek these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:161
verses.text: For tell me, with what pomp of words did Paul speak? and yet he converted the world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:162
verses.text: Or with what the unlettered Peter? But I know not, you say, the things that are contained in the Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:163
verses.text: Why? For are they spoken in Hebrew? Are they in Latin, or in foreign tongues? Are they not in Greek? But they are expressed obscurely, you say: What is it that is obscure? Tell me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:164
verses.text: Are there not histories? For (of course) you know the plain parts, in that you enquire about the obscure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:165
verses.text: There are numberless histories in the Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:166
verses.text: Tell me one of these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:167
verses.text: But you cannot.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:168
verses.text: These things are an excuse, and mere words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:169
verses.text: Every day, you say, one hears the same things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:170
verses.text: Tell me, then, do you not hear the same things in the theaters? Do you not see the same things in the race-course? Are not all things the same? Is it not always the same sun that rises? Is it not the same food that we use? I should like to ask you, since you say that you every day hear the same things; tell me, from what Prophet was the passage that was read? from what Apostle, or what Epistle? But you cannot tell me—you seem to hear strange things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:171
verses.text: When therefore you wish to be slothful, you say that they are the same things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:172
verses.text: But when you are questioned, you are in the case of one who never heard them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:173
verses.text: If they are the same, you ought to know them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:174
verses.text: But you are ignorant of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:175
verses.text: This state of things is worthy of lamentation—of lamentation and complaint: for the coiner coineth but in vain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:176
verses.text: For this you ought more especially to attend, because they are the same things, because we give you no labor, nor speak things that are strange or variable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:177
verses.text: What then, since you say, that those are the same things, but our discourses are not the same things, but we always speak things that are new to you, do you pay heed to these? By no means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:178
verses.text: But if we say, Why do you not retain even these? "We hear them but once," you say, "and how can we retain them?" If we say, Why do ye not attend to those other things? "The same things," you say, "are always said"—and every way these are words of sloth and excuse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:179
verses.text: But they will not always serve, but there will be a time when we shall lament in vain and without effect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 4:180
verses.text: Which may God forbid, and grant that having repented here, and attending with understanding and godly fear to the things spoken, we may both be urged on to the due performance of good works, and may amend our own lives with all diligence, that we may be able to obtain the blessings promised to those who love Him, by the grace and lovingkindness, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:1
verses.text: Homily IV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:2
verses.text: Thessalonians ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:3
verses.text: –  "And now ye know that which restraineth, to the end that he may be revealed in his own season.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:4
verses.text: For the mystery of lawlessness doth already work: only there is one that restraineth now, until he be taken out of the way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:5
verses.text: And then shall be revealed the lawless one, whom the Lord Jesus shall slay with the breath of His mouth, and bring to nought by the manifestation of His coming: even he whose coming is according to the working of Satan".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:6
verses.text: One may naturally enquire, what is that which withholdeth, and after that would know, why Paul expresses it so obscurely.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:7
verses.text: What then is it that withholdeth, that is, hindereth him from being revealed? Some indeed say, the grace of the Spirit, but others the Roman empire, to whom I most of all accede.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:8
verses.text: Wherefore? Because if he meant to say the Spirit, he would not have spoken obscurely, but plainly, that even now the grace of the Spirit, that is the gifts, withhold him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:9
verses.text: And otherwise he ought now to have come, if he was about to come when the gifts ceased; for they have long since ceased.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:10
verses.text: But because he said this of the Roman empire, he naturally glanced at it, and speaks covertly and darkly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:11
verses.text: For he did not wish to bring upon himself superfluous enmities, and useless dangers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:12
verses.text: For if he had said that after a little while the Roman empire would be dissolved, they would immediately have even overwhelmed him, as a pestilent person, and all the faithful, as living and warring to this end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:13
verses.text: And he did not say that it will be quickly, although he is always saying it—but what? "that he may be revealed in his own season," he says,  "For the mystery of lawlessness doth already work".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:14
verses.text: He speaks here of Nero, as if he were the type of Antichrist.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:15
verses.text: For he too wished to be thought a god.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:16
verses.text: And he has well said, "the mystery"; that is, it worketh not openly, as the other, nor without shame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:17
verses.text: For if there was found a man before that time, he means, who was not much behind Antichrist in wickedness, what wonder, if there shall now be one? But he did not also wish to point him out plainly: and this not from cowardice, but instructing us not to bring upon ourselves unnecessary enmities, when there is nothing to call for it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:18
verses.text: So indeed he also says here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:19
verses.text: "Only there is one that restraineth now, until he be taken out of the way," that is, when the Roman empire is taken out of the way, then he shall come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:20
verses.text: And naturally.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:21
verses.text: For as long as the fear of this empire lasts, no one will willingly exalt himself, but when that is dissolved, he will attack the anarchy, and endeavor to seize upon the government both of man and of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:22
verses.text: For as the kingdoms before this were destroyed, for example, that of the Medes by the Babylonians, that of the Babylonians by the Persians, that of the Persians by the Macedonians, that of the Macedonians by the Romans: so will this also be by the Antichrist, and he by Christ, and it will no longer withhold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:23
verses.text: And these things Daniel delivered to us with great clearness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:24
verses.text: "And then," he says, "shall be revealed the lawless one".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:25
verses.text: And what after this? The consolation is at hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:26
verses.text: "Whom the Lord Jesus shall slay with the breath of His mouth, and bring to nought by the manifestation of His coming, even he whose coming is according to the working of Satan".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:27
verses.text: For as fire merely coming on even before its arrival makes torpid and consumes the little animals that are afar off; so also Christ, by His commandment only, and Coming.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:28
verses.text: It is enough for Him to be present, and all these things are destroyed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:29
verses.text: He will put a stop to the deceit, by only appearing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:30
verses.text: Then who is this, whose coming is after the working of Satan, "With all display all power," but nothing true, but for deceit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:31
verses.text: "And lying wonder," he says, that is, false, or leading to falsehood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:32
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:33
verses.text: "And with all deceit of unrighteousness for them that are perishing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:34
verses.text: Why then, you say, did God permit this to be? and what dispensation is this? And what is the advantage of his coming, if it takes place for the ruin of our race? Fear not, beloved, but hear Him saying, "In them that are perishing," he hath strength, who, even if he had not come, would not have believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:35
verses.text: What then is the advantage? That these very men who are perishing will be put to silence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:36
verses.text: How? Because both if he had come, and if he had not come, they would not have believed in Christ; He comes therefore to convict them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:37
verses.text: For that they may not have occasion to say, that since Christ said that He was God,—although He nowhere said this openly,—but since those who came after proclaimed it, we have not believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:38
verses.text: Because we have heard that there is One God from whom are all things, therefore we have not believed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:39
verses.text: This their pretext then Antichrist will take away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:40
verses.text: For when he comes, and comes commanding nothing good, but all things unlawful, and is yet believed from false signs alone, he will stop their mouths.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:41
verses.text: For if thou believest not in Christ, much more oughtest thou not to believe in Antichrist.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:42
verses.text: For the former said that He was sent from the Father, but the latter the contrary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:43
verses.text: For this reason Christ said, "I am come in My Father's name, and ye receive Me not: if another shall come in his own name.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:44
verses.text: him ye will receive".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:45
verses.text: (John v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:46
verses.text: ) But we have seen signs, you say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:47
verses.text: But many and great signs were also wrought in the case of Christ; much more therefore ought ye to have believed in Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:48
verses.text: And yet many things were predicted concerning this one, that he is the lawless one, that he is the son of perdition, that his coming is after the working of Satan.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:49
verses.text: But the contrary concerning the other, that He is the Saviour, that He brings with Him unnumbered blessings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:50
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:52
verses.text: "For because they received not the love of the truth, that they might be saved; for this cause God will send them a working of error, that they should believe a lie: that they all might be judged who believed not the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:53
verses.text: "That they might be judged".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:54
verses.text: He does not say, that they might be punished; for even before this they were about to be punished; but "that they might be condemned," that is, at the dreadful Seat of Judgment, in order that they might be without excuse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:55
verses.text: "Who believed not the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:56
verses.text: He calls Christ, "the Love of the Truth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:57
verses.text: "For because," says he, "they received not the love of the truth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:58
verses.text: For He was both, and came for the sake of both, both as loving men, and on behalf of things that were true.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:59
verses.text: "But had pleasure," he says, "in unrighteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:60
verses.text: For he came to the destruction of men and to injure them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:61
verses.text: For what will he not then work? He will change and confound all things, both by his commandments, and by the fear of him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:62
verses.text: He will be terrible in every way, from his power, from his cruelty, from his unlawful commandments.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:63
verses.text: But fear not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:64
verses.text: "In those that perish" he will have his strength.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:65
verses.text: For Elijah too will then come to give confidence to the faithful, and this Christ says; "Elijah cometh, and shall restore all things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:66
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:67
verses.text: xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:68
verses.text: ) Therefore it is said, "In the spirit and power of Elijah".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:69
verses.text: (Luke i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:70
verses.text: ) For he neither wrought signs nor wonders, as Elijah did.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:71
verses.text: For "John," it is said, "did no miracle, but all things which John spake of this Man were true".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:72
verses.text: How then was it "in the spirit and power of Elijah"? That is, he will take upon him the same ministry.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:73
verses.text: As the one was the forerunner of His first Coming, so will the other be of His second and glorious Coming, and for this he is reserved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:74
verses.text: Let us not therefore fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:75
verses.text: He has calmed the minds of the hearers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:76
verses.text: He causes them no longer to think present things dreadful but worthy of thankfulness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:77
verses.text: Wherefore he has added,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:78
verses.text: "But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you, brethren beloved of the Lord, for that God chose you from the beginning unto salvation, in sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:79
verses.text: How unto salvation? By sanctifying you through the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:80
verses.text: For these are the things that are the efficient causes of our salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:81
verses.text: It is nowhere of works, nowhere of righteous deeds, but through belief of the truth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:82
verses.text: Here again, "in" is used for "through".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:83
verses.text: "And through sanctification of the Spirit," he says,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:84
verses.text: "Whereunto He called you through our Gospel to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:85
verses.text: This too is no little thing, if Christ considers our salvation His glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:86
verses.text: For it is the glory of the Friend of man that they that are saved should be many.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:87
verses.text: Great then is our Lord, if the Holy Spirit so desires our salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:88
verses.text: Why did he not say faith first? Because even after sanctification we have yet need of much faith, that we may not be shaken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:89
verses.text: Seest thou how He shows that nothing is of themselves, but all of God?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:90
verses.text: "So then, brethren, stand fast, and hold the traditions which ye were taught, whether by word, or by Epistle of ours".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:91
verses.text: Hence it is manifest, that they did not deliver all things by Epistle, but many things also unwritten, and in like manner both the one and the other are worthy of credit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:92
verses.text: Therefore let us think the tradition of the Church also worthy of credit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:93
verses.text: It is a tradition, seek no farther.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:94
verses.text: Here he shows that there were many who were shaken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:95
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:97
verses.text: "Now our Lord Jesus Christ Himself, and God our Father, which loved us, and gave us eternal comfort and good hope through grace, comfort your hearts, and stablish them in every good work and word".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:98
verses.text: Again a prayer after an admonition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:99
verses.text: For this is truly to benefit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:100
verses.text: "Which loved us," he says, "and gave us eternal comfort and good hope through grace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:101
verses.text: Where now are those who lessen the Son, because He is named in the grace of the Laver after the Father? For, lo, here it is the contrary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:102
verses.text: "Which loved us," he says, "and gave us eternal comfort".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:103
verses.text: Of what sort then is this? Even the hope of things future.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:104
verses.text: Seest thou how by the method of prayer he stirs up their mind, giving them the unspeakable care of God for pledges and signs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:105
verses.text: "Comfort your heart," he says, "in every good work and word," that is, through every good work and word.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:106
verses.text: For this is the comfort of Christians, to do something good and pleasing to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:107
verses.text: See how he brings down their spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:108
verses.text: "Which gave us comfort," he says, "and good hope through grace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:109
verses.text: At the same time he makes them also full of good hopes with respect to future things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:110
verses.text: For if He has given so many things by grace, much more things future.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:111
verses.text: I indeed, he says, have spoken, but the whole is of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:112
verses.text: "Stablish"; confirm you, that you be not shaken, nor turned aside.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:113
verses.text: For this is both His work and ours, so that it is in the way both of doctrines, and of actions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:114
verses.text: For this is comfort, to be stablished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:115
verses.text: For when any one is not turned aside, he bears all things, whatever may happen to him, with much longsuffering; whereas if his mind be shaken, he will no longer perform any good or noble action, but like one whose hands are paralyzed, so also his soul is shaken, when it is not fully persuaded that it is advancing to some good end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:116
verses.text: Chap.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:117
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:118
verses.text: "Finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may run and be glorified, even as also it is with you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:119
verses.text: He indeed had prayed for them, that they might be stablished; and now he asks of them, entreating them to pray for him, not that he may not incur danger, for to this he was appointed, but that "the word of the Lord may run and be glorified, even as also it is with you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:120
verses.text: And the request is accompanied with commendation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:121
verses.text: "Even as also it is with you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:122
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:123
verses.text: "And that we may be delivered from unreasonable and evil men; for all have not faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:124
verses.text: This is the manner of one showing also his dangers as to which especially he besought them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:125
verses.text: "From unreasonable and evil men," he says, "for all have not faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:126
verses.text: Thus he is speaking of those who contradict the Preaching, who oppose and contend against the doctrines.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:127
verses.text: For this he has intimated by saying, "For all men have not faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:128
verses.text: And here he seems to me not to glance at dangers, but at the men who contradicted and hindered his word, as did Alexander the copper-smith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:129
verses.text: For he says, "he greatly withstood our words".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:130
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:131
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:132
verses.text: ) That is, there are some to whom it is given.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:133
verses.text: As if he were speaking of a paternal inheritance, that "it is not for all to serve in the Palace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:134
verses.text: And at the same time he also excites them, as already having such ground of confidence as to be able both to deliver their Teacher from dangers, and to facilitate his preaching.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:135
verses.text: Therefore we also say the same things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:136
verses.text: Let no one condemn us of arrogance, nor from an excessive humility deprive us of so great an assistance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:137
verses.text: For neither do we speak from the same motive from which Paul spoke.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:138
verses.text: For he indeed said these things from a wish to comfort his disciples; but we to reap some great and good fruit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:139
verses.text: And we are very confident, if ye all be willing with one mind to stretch forth your hands to God in behalf of our littleness, that you will succeed in all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:140
verses.text: Thus let us make war with our enemies with prayers and supplications.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:141
verses.text: For if thus the ancients made war with men in arms, much more ought we so to make war with men without arms.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:142
verses.text: So Hezekiah triumphed over the Assyrian king, so Moses over Amalek, so Samuel over the men of Ascalon, so Israel over the thirty-two kings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:143
verses.text: If where there was need of arms, and of battle array, and of fighting, they, leaving their arms.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:144
verses.text: had recourse to prayer; here where the matter has to be accomplished by prayers alone, does it not much more behove us to pray?  But there, you say, the rulers entreated for the people, but you request the people to entreat for the ruler.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:145
verses.text: I also know it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:146
verses.text: For those under rule at that time were wretched and mean persons.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:147
verses.text: Wherefore they were saved by the claims and the virtue of their commander alone; but now, when the grace of God has prevailed, and we shall find among those who are ruled many or rather the greater part excelling their ruler in a great degree; do not deprive us of this succor, raise up our hands that they may not be faint, open our mouth for us, that it may not be closed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:148
verses.text: Entreat God—for this cause entreat Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:149
verses.text: It is in our behalf indeed that it is done, but it is wholly for your sakes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:150
verses.text: For we are appointed for your advantage, and for your interests we are concerned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:151
verses.text: Entreat every one of you, both privately and publicly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:152
verses.text: Mark Paul saying, "That for the gift bestowed upon us by means of many, thanks may be given by many persons on our behalf" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:153
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:154
verses.text: ); that is, that He may give grace to many.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:155
verses.text: If in the case of men, the people coming forward ask a pardon for persons condemned and led away to execution, and the king from regard to the multitude revokes the sentence, much more will God be influenced by regard to you, not by your multitude but your virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:156
verses.text: For violent is the enemy we have.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:157
verses.text: For each of you indeed anxiously thinks of his own interests, but we the concerns of all together.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:158
verses.text: We stand in the part of the battle that is pressed on.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:159
verses.text: The devil is more violently armed against us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:160
verses.text: For in wars too, he that is on the opposite side endeavors before all others to overthrow the general.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:161
verses.text: For this reason all his fellow-combatants hasten there.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:162
verses.text: For this reason there is much tumult, every one endeavoring to rescue him; they surround him with their shields, wishing to preserve his person.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:163
verses.text: Hear what all the people say to David.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:164
verses.text: (I say not this, as comparing myself to David, I am not so mad, but because I wish to show the affection of the people for their ruler.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:165
verses.text: ) "Thou shalt go no more out with us to battle," they say, "that thou quench not the lamp of Israel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:166
verses.text: ( Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:167
verses.text: xxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:168
verses.text: ) See how anxious they were to spare the old man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:169
verses.text: I am greatly in need of your prayers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:170
verses.text: Let no one, as I have said, from an excessive humility deprive me of this alliance and succor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:171
verses.text: If our part be well approved, your own also will be more honorable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:172
verses.text: If our teaching flow abundantly, the riches will redound to you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:173
verses.text: Hear the prophet saying, "Do the shepherds feed themselves?" (From Ezek.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:174
verses.text: xxxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:175
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:176
verses.text: )  Do you observe Paul constantly seeking these prayers? Do you hear that thus Peter was delivered from prison, when fervent prayer was made for him? (Acts xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:177
verses.text: ) I verily believe that your prayer will have great effect, offered with so great unanimity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:178
verses.text: Do you not think that it is a matter much too great for my littleness to draw nigh to God, and entreat Him for so numerous a people? For if I have not confidence to pray for myself, much less for others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:179
verses.text: For it belongs to men of high estimation, to beseech God to be merciful to others; it is for those who have rendered Him favorable to themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:180
verses.text: But he who is himself an offender, how shall he entreat for another? But nevertheless, because I embrace you with a father's heart, because love dares everything, not only in the Church, but in the house also, I make my prayer above all other things for your health both in soul and in body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:181
verses.text: For there is no other people, before his own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:182
verses.text: For if Job rising up immediately made so many offerings for his children in the flesh, how much more ought we to do this for our spiritual children?  Why do I say these things? Because if we who are so far removed from the greatness of the work, offer supplications and prayers for you, much more is it just that you should do it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:183
verses.text: For that one should entreat for many, is exceedingly bold, and requires much confidence: but that many having met together should offer supplication for one, is nothing burdensome.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:184
verses.text: For every one does this not trusting to his own virtue, but to the multitude, and to their unanimity, to which God everywhere has much respect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:185
verses.text: For He says, "where two or three are gathered together in My Name, there am I in the midst of them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:186
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:187
verses.text: xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:188
verses.text: ) If where two or three are gathered together, He is in the midst, much more is He among you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:189
verses.text: For that which a man praying by himself is not able to receive, that he shall receive praying with a multitude.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:190
verses.text: Why? Because although his own virtue has not, yet the common consent has much power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:191
verses.text: "Where two or three," it is said, "are gathered together".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:192
verses.text: Why didst thou say, "Two"? For if there be one in Thy Name, why art Thou not there? Because I wish all to be together, and not to be separated.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:193
verses.text: Let us therefore close up together; let us bind one another together in love, let no one separate us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:194
verses.text: If any one accuses, or is offended, let him not retain it in his mind, whether against his neighbor, or against us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:195
verses.text: This favor I ask of you, to come to us, and bring the accusation, and receive our defense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:196
verses.text: "Reprove him," it says, "lest haply he hath not said it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:197
verses.text: Reprove him, lest haply he hath not done it" (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:198
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:200
verses.text: ); and if he hath done it, that he add not thereto.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:201
verses.text: For we have either defended ourselves, or being condemned have asked pardon, and henceforth endeavor not to fall into the same faults.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:202
verses.text: This is expedient both for you and for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:203
verses.text: For you indeed having accused us perhaps without reason, when you have learned the truth of the matter, will stand corrected, and we have offended unawares and are corrected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:204
verses.text: For you indeed it is not expedient.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:205
verses.text: For punishment is appointed for those who utter any idle word.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:206
verses.text: But we put off accusations, whether false or true.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:207
verses.text: The false, by showing that they are false; the true, by not again doing the same things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:208
verses.text: For it must needs happen that he who has the care of so many things should be ignorant, and through ignorance commit errors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:209
verses.text: For if every one of you having a house, and presiding over wife and children, and slaves, one more and another fewer, among souls that are so easily numbered, is nevertheless compelled to commit many errors involuntarily, or from ignorance, or when wishing to set something right; much more must it be so with us who preside over so many people.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:210
verses.text: And may God still multiply you and bless you, the little with the great! For although the care becomes greater from the increase of numbers, we do not cease praying that this our care may be increased, and that this number may be added to, and be many times as great and without limit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:211
verses.text: For fathers, although often harassed by the number of their children, nevertheless do not wish to lose any one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:212
verses.text: All things are equal between us and you, even the very chief of our blessings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:213
verses.text: I do not partake of the holy Table with greater abundance, and you with less, but both equally participate of the same.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:214
verses.text: And if I take it first, it is no great privilege, since even among children, the elder first extends his hand to the feast, but nevertheless no advantage is gained thereby.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:215
verses.text: But with us all things are equal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:216
verses.text: The saving life that sustains our souls is given with equal honor to both.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:217
verses.text: I do not indeed partake of one Lamb and you of another, but we partake of the same.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:218
verses.text: We both have the same Baptism.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:219
verses.text: We have been vouchsafed the same Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:220
verses.text: We are both hastening to the same kingdom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:221
verses.text: We are alike brethren of Christ, we have all things in common.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:222
verses.text: Where then is my advantage? In cares, in labors, in anxieties, in grieving for you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:223
verses.text: But nothing is sweeter than this grief, since even a mother grieving for her child is delighted with her grief, she thinks carefully of those whom she has brought forth, she is delighted at her cares.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:224
verses.text: And yet care in itself is bitter, but when it is for children, at least it has in it much pleasure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:225
verses.text: Many of you have I begotten, but after this are my pangs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:226
verses.text: For in the case of mothers in the flesh the pangs are first, and then the birth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:227
verses.text: But here the pangs last till the latest breath, lest there should be anywhere some abortion even after the birth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:228
verses.text: And I indeed have a further longing; for although perchance another has begotten you, yet I nevertheless am harassed with cares.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:229
verses.text: For we do not of ourselves beget you, but it is all of the grace of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:230
verses.text: But if we both through the Spirit beget, he will not err who calls those begotten by me, his children, and those begotten by him, mine.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 5:231
verses.text: All these things then consider, and stretch forth your hand, that you may be our boast and we yours, in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ, which God grant that we may all see with confidence, through Jesus Christ our Lord, with whom, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:1
verses.text: Homily V.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:2
verses.text: Thessalonians iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:3
verses.text: –  " But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and guard you from the evil one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:4
verses.text: And we have confidence in the Lord touching you that ye both do and will do the things which we command you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:5
verses.text: And the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, and into the patience of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:6
verses.text: Neither ought we, having committed everything to the prayers of the Saints, to be idle ourselves, and run into wickedness, and to lay hold of nothing; nor again when working good to despise that succor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:7
verses.text: For great indeed are the things which prayer for us can effect, but it is when we ourselves also work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:8
verses.text: For this reason Paul also, praying for them, and again giving them assurance from the promise, says, "But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and guard you from the evil one".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:9
verses.text: For if He has chosen you to salvation, He does not deceive you, nor suffer you utterly to perish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:10
verses.text: But that he may not by these means lead them to sloth, and lest they thinking the whole to be of God should themselves sleep, see how he also demands coöperation from them, saying, "And we have confidence in the Lord touching you, that ye both do and will do the things which we command you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:11
verses.text: "The Lord" indeed, he says, "is faithful," and having promised to save will certainly save; but as He promised.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:12
verses.text: And how did He promise? If we be willing, and hear Him; not simply (hearing), nor like stocks and stones, being inactive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:13
verses.text: And he has well introduced the words, "We have confidence in the Lord," that is, we trust to His lovingkindness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:14
verses.text: Again he brings them down, making everything depend thereupon.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:15
verses.text: For if he had said, We have confidence in you, the commendation indeed was great, but it would not have taught them to make all things dependent upon God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:16
verses.text: And if he had said, We have confidence in the Lord, that He will preserve you, and had not added "as touching you," and, "that ye do and will do the things which we command you," he would have made them more slothful, by casting everything upon the power of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:17
verses.text: For it becomes us indeed to cast everything upon Him, yet working also ourselves, embarked in the labors and the conflicts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:18
verses.text: And he shows that even if our virtue alone were sufficient to save, yet nevertheless it ought to be persevering, and to abide with us until we come to our latest breath.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:19
verses.text: "But the Lord," he says, "direct your hearts into the love of God, and the patience of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:20
verses.text: Again he commends them, and prays, showing his concern for them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:21
verses.text: For when he is about to enter upon reproof, he previously smooths down their minds, by saying, "I am confident that ye will hear," and by requesting prayers from them, and by again invoking upon them infinite blessings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:22
verses.text: "But the Lord," he says, "direct your hearts into the love of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:23
verses.text: For there are many things that turn us aside from love, and there are many paths that draw us away from thence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:24
verses.text: In the first place the path of Mammon, laying, as it were, certain shameless hands upon our soul, and tenaciously holding it in its grasp, draws and drags us thence even against our will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:25
verses.text: Then vainglory and often afflictions and temptations, turn us aside.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:26
verses.text: For this reason we need, as a certain wind, the assistance of God, that our sail may be impelled, as by some strong wind, to the love of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:27
verses.text: For tell me not, "I love Him, even more than myself".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:28
verses.text: These are words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:29
verses.text: Show it to me by thy works, if thou lovest Him more than thyself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:30
verses.text: Love Him more than money, and then I shall believe that thou lovest Him even more than thyself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:31
verses.text: But thou who despisest not riches for the sake of God, how wilt thou despise thyself? But why do I say riches? Thou who despisest not covetousness, which thou oughtest to do even without the commandments of God, how wilt thou despise thyself?  "And into the patience of Christ," he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:32
verses.text: What is "into the patience"? That we should endure even as He endured, or that we should do those things, or that with patience also we should wait for Him, that is, that we should be prepared.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:33
verses.text: For since He has promised many things, and Himself is coming to judge the quick and the dead, let us wait for Him, and let us be patient.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:34
verses.text: But wherever he speaks of patience, he of course implies affliction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:35
verses.text: For this is to love God; to endure, and not to be troubled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:36
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:37
verses.text: "Now we command you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye withdraw yourselves from every brother that walketh disorderly and not after the tradition which they received of us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:38
verses.text: That is, it is not we that say these things, but Christ, for that is the meaning of "in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ"; equivalent to "through Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:39
verses.text: Showing the fearfulness of the message, he says, through Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:40
verses.text: Christ therefore commanded us in no case to be idle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:41
verses.text: "That ye withdraw yourselves," he says, "from every brother".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:42
verses.text: Tell me not of the rich, tell me not of the poor, tell me not of the holy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:43
verses.text: This is disorder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:44
verses.text: "That walketh," he says, that is, liveth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:45
verses.text: "And not after the tradition which they received from me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:46
verses.text: Tradition, he says, which is through works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:47
verses.text: And this he always calls properly tradition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:48
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:50
verses.text: "For yourselves know how ye ought to imitate us: for we behaved not ourselves disorderly among you; neither did we eat bread for nought at any man's hand".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:51
verses.text: And yet even if they had eaten, it would not have been for nought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:52
verses.text: "For the laborer," he says, "is worthy of his hire".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:53
verses.text: (Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:54
verses.text: )  "But in labor and travail, working night and day, that we might not burden any of you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:55
verses.text: Not because we have not the right, but to make ourselves an ensample unto you that ye should imitate us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:56
verses.text: For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, If any will not work, neither let him eat".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:57
verses.text: See how in the former Epistle indeed he discourses somewhat more mildly concerning these things; as when he says, "We beseech you, brethren,—that ye would abound more and more—and that ye study" ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:58
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:60
verses.text: )—and nowhere does he say, "we command," nor "in the Name of our Lord Jesus Christ," which was fearful and implied danger, but that "ye abound," he says, and "study," which are the words of one exhorting to virtue; "that ye may walk honestly" (becomingly), he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:61
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:62
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:63
verses.text: ) But here is nothing of this kind, but "if any one will not work," says he, "neither let him eat".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:64
verses.text: For if Paul, not being under a necessity, and having a right to be idle, and having undertaken so great a work, did nevertheless work, and not merely work, but "night and day," so that he was able even to assist others,—much more ought others to do this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:65
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:66
verses.text: "For we hear of some that walk among you disorderly, that work not at all, but are busybodies".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:67
verses.text: This indeed he says here; but there, in the first Epistle, he says, "that ye may walk honestly towards them that are without".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:68
verses.text: On what account? Perhaps there was as yet no such thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:69
verses.text: For upon another occasion also admonishing, he says, "It is more blessed to give than to receive".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:70
verses.text: (Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:71
verses.text: ) But the expression, "walk honestly" has no reference to disorder; wherefore he added, "that ye may have need of nothing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:72
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:73
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:74
verses.text: ) And here he sets down another necessity, for thus doing what was honorable and good towards all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:75
verses.text: (For as he proceeds, he says, "be not weary in well doing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:76
verses.text: ) For certainly he that is idle and yet able to work must needs be a busybody.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:77
verses.text: But alms are given to those only who are not able to support themselves by the work of their own hands, or who teach, and are wholly occupied in the business of teaching.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:78
verses.text: "For thou shalt not muzzle the ox," he says, "when he treadeth out the corn".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:79
verses.text: (Deut.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:80
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:81
verses.text: ) "And the laborer is worthy of his hire".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:82
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:83
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:84
verses.text: , and Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:85
verses.text: ) So that neither is he idle, but receives the reward of work and great work too.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:86
verses.text: But to pray and fast, being idle, is not the work of the hands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:87
verses.text: For the work that he is here speaking of is the work of the hands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:88
verses.text: And that you may not suspect any such thing, he has added,  "That work not at all, but are busybodies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:89
verses.text: Now them that are such we command and exhort through our Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:90
verses.text: Because he had touched them severely, wishing to render his discourse more mild, he adds, "through the Lord," again what is authoritivate and fearful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:91
verses.text: "That with quietness," he says, "they work, and eat their own bread".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:92
verses.text: For why has he not said, But if they are not disorderly let them be maintained by you; but requires both, that they be quiet, and that they work? "That they may eat their own bread," says he, not that of another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:93
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:94
verses.text: "But ye, brethren, be not weary in well doing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:95
verses.text: See how immediately the fatherly heart was overcome.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:96
verses.text: He was not able to carry out his reproof farther, but again pitied them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:97
verses.text: And see with what discretion! He has not said, But pardon them, until they are amended; but what? "But ye, be not weary in well doing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:98
verses.text: Withdraw yourselves, he says, from them, and reprove them; do not, however, suffer them to perish with hunger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:99
verses.text: What then, he says, if having abundance from us, he should remain idle? In that case, he says, I have spoken of a mild remedy, that you withdraw yourselves from him, that is, do not partake with him in free conversation; show that you are angry.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:100
verses.text: This is no little matter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:101
verses.text: For such is the reproof that is given to a brother, if we wish really to amend him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:102
verses.text: We are not ignorant of the methods of reproof.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:103
verses.text: For tell me, if you had a brother in the flesh, would you then overlook him pining with hunger? Truly I think not; but perhaps you would even correct him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:104
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:105
verses.text: "And if any man obeyeth not our word by this Epistle".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:106
verses.text: He has not said, He that disobeys, disobeys me, but "note that man".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:107
verses.text: This is no slight chastisement.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:108
verses.text: "Have no company with him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:109
verses.text: Then again he says, "that he may be ashamed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:110
verses.text: And he does not permit them to proceed farther.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:111
verses.text: For as he had said, "if any does not work neither let him eat" fearing lest they should perish by hunger, he has added, "But in doing good, be not ye weary".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:112
verses.text: Thus having said, "Withdraw yourselves, and have no company with him," then fearing lest this very thing might cut him off from the brotherhood—for he who gives himself up to despair will quickly be lost if he is not admitted to freedom of conversation—he has added,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:113
verses.text: "Yet count him not as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:114
verses.text: By this he shows that he has assigned a heavy punishment against him, in depriving him of freedom of conversation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:115
verses.text: For if to be a receiver even with many others is worthy of disgrace, when they even reprove whilst they offer it, and withdraw themselves, how great is the reproach, quite sufficient to sting the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:116
verses.text: For if only giving rather tardily, and with murmuring, they inflame the receivers—for tell me not of impudent beggars, but of the faithful—if they were to reprove whilst they give, what would they not do? to what punishment would it not be equal? We do not do so, but as if we had been greatly injured, we so insult and turn away from those who beg of us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:117
verses.text: Thou dost not give, but why dost thou also grieve him? "Admonish them," he says, "as brethren," do not insult them as enemies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:118
verses.text: He who admonishes his brother, does it not publicly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:119
verses.text: He does not make an open show of the insult, but he does it privately and with much address, and grieving, as hurt, and weeping and lamenting.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:120
verses.text: Let us bestow therefore with the disposition of a brother, let us admonish with the good will of a brother, not as if we grieved at giving, but as if we grieved for his transgressing the commandment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:121
verses.text: Since what is the advantage? For if, even after giving, you insult, you destroy the pleasure of giving.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:122
verses.text: But when you do not give and yet insult, what wrong do you not do to that wretched and unfortunate man? He came to you, to receive pity from you, but he goes away having received a deadly blow, and weeps the more.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:123
verses.text: For when by reason of his poverty he is compelled to beg, and is insulted on account of his begging, think how great will be the punishment of those who insult him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:124
verses.text: "He that dishonoreth the poor," it says, "provoketh his Maker".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:125
verses.text: (Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:126
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:127
verses.text: , , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:128
verses.text: ) For tell me, did He suffer him to be poor for thy sake, that thou mightest be able to heal thyself—and dost thou insult him who for thy sake is poor? What obstinacy is this! what an act of ingratitude is it! "Admonish him as a brother," he says, and after having given, he orders you to admonish him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:129
verses.text: But if even without giving we insult him, what excuse shall we have?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:130
verses.text: "Now the Lord of peace Himself give you peace at all times in all ways".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:131
verses.text: See how, when he mentions the things that are to be done, he sets his mark upon them by prayer, adding prayer and supplication, like certain marks set upon things that are laid up.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:132
verses.text: "Give you peace," he says, "at all times, in all ways".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:133
verses.text: For since it was likely that contentions would arise from these things, those men becoming exasperated, and the others not supplying such persons so readily as formerly, he with good reason now offered this prayer for them, saying, "Give you peace at all times".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:134
verses.text: For this is what is sought, that they may ever have it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:135
verses.text: "In every way," says he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:136
verses.text: What is, "in every"? So that they may have no occasion of contention from any quarter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:137
verses.text: For everywhere peace is a good thing, even towards those who are without.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:138
verses.text: For hear him elsewhere saying, "If it be possible, as much as in you lieth, be at peace with all men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:139
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:140
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:141
verses.text: ) For nothing is so conducive to the right performance of the things which we wish, as to be peaceable and undisturbed, and to be flee from all hatred, and to have no enemy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:142
verses.text: "The Lord be with you all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:143
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:145
verses.text: "The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand, which is the token in every Epistle: so I write.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:146
verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:147
verses.text: This he says that he writes in every Epistle, that no one may be able to counterfeit them, his subscription being subjoined as a great token.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:148
verses.text: And he calls the prayer a salutation, showing that everything they then did was spiritual; even when it was proper to offer salutation, the thing was attended with advantage; and it was prayer, not merely a symbol of friendship.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:149
verses.text: With this he began, and with it he ended, guarding with strong walls what he had said elsewhere, and laying safe foundations, he brought it also to a safe end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:150
verses.text: "Grace be unto you and peace," he says; and again, "The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all, Amen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:151
verses.text: This the Lord also promised, saying to His disciples, "Lo, I am with you alway, even unto the end of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:152
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:153
verses.text: xxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:154
verses.text: ) But this takes place when we are willing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:155
verses.text: For He will not be altogether with us, if we place ourselves at a distance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:156
verses.text: "I will be with you," He says, "always".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:157
verses.text: Let us not therefore drive away grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:158
verses.text: He tells us to withdraw from every brother that walketh disorderly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:159
verses.text: This was then a great evil, to be separated from the whole body of the brethren.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:160
verses.text: By this indeed he punishes all, as elsewhere in his Epistle to the Corinthians he said, "With such a one no, not to eat".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:161
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:162
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:163
verses.text: ) But now the majority do not think this a great evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:164
verses.text: But all things are confounded and corrupted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:165
verses.text: With adulterers, with fornicators, with covetous persons, we mix freely, and as a matter of course.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:166
verses.text: If we ought to withdraw ourselves from one who was only supported in idleness, how much more from the others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:167
verses.text: And that you may know how fearful a thing it was to be separated from the company of the brethren, and what advantage it produces to those who receive reproof with a right mind, hear how that man, who was puffed up with sin, who had proceeded to the extreme of wickedness, who had committed such fornication as is not named even among the heathens, who was insensible of his wound—for this is the excess of perversion—he after all, though such an one, was so bent down and humbled that Paul said, "Sufficient to such a one is this punishment which was inflicted by the many.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:168
verses.text: Wherefore confirm your love toward him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:169
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:170
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:172
verses.text: ) For as a member separated from the rest of the body, so was he at that time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:173
verses.text: But the cause, and that from which this was then so terrible, was, because even the being with them was thought by them a great blessing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:174
verses.text: For like men who inhabit one house, and are under one father, and partake of one table, so did they then dwell in every Church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:175
verses.text: How great an evil therefore was it to fall from so great love! But now it is not even thought to be a great evil, because neither is it considered any great thing when we are united with one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:176
verses.text: What was then in the order of punishment, this, on account of the great coldness of love, now takes place even apart from punishment, and we withdraw from one another causelessly, and from coldness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:177
verses.text: For it is the cause of all evils that there is no love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:178
verses.text: This has dissolved all ties, and has disfigured all that was venerable and splendid in the Church, in which we ought to have gloried.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:179
verses.text: Great is the confidence of the Teacher, when from his own good actions he is entitled to reprove his disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:180
verses.text: Wherefore also Paul said, "For yourselves know how ye ought to imitate us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:181
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:182
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:183
verses.text: ) And he ought to be a Teacher more of life than of the word.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:184
verses.text: And let no one think that this is said from a spirit of boasting.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:185
verses.text: For it was as reduced to necessity that he spoke it, and with a view to general advantage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:186
verses.text: "For we behaved not ourselves," he says, "disorderly among you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:187
verses.text: From this do you not see his humility, in that he calls it, "for nought," and "disorderly behavior"? "We did not behave ourselves disorderly among you," he says, "neither did we eat any man's bread for nought".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:188
verses.text: Here he shows that perhaps also they were poor; and tell me not, that they were poor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:189
verses.text: For he is discoursing concerning the poor, and those who obtained their necessary subsistence from no other source than from the work of their hands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:190
verses.text: For he has not said, that they may have it from their fathers, but that by working they should eat their own bread.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:191
verses.text: For if I, he says, a herald of the word of doctrine, was afraid to burden you, much more he who does you no service.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:192
verses.text: For this is truly a burden.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:193
verses.text: And it is a burden too, when one does not give with much alacrity; but this is not what he hints at, but as if they were not able to do it easily.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:194
verses.text: For why dost thou not work? For God hath given thee hands for this purpose, not that thou shouldest receive from others, but that thou shouldest impart to others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:195
verses.text: But "the Lord," he says, "be with you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:196
verses.text: This prayer also we may offer for ourselves, if we do the things of the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:197
verses.text: For hear Christ saying to His disciples, "Go ye and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them into the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost: teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I commanded you: and, lo, I am with you alway, even unto the end of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:198
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:199
verses.text: xxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:201
verses.text: ) If ye do these things, assuredly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:202
verses.text: For that the promise is not made to them only, but to those also who walk in their steps, is manifest from His saying "to the end of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:203
verses.text: What then does He say to those who are not teachers? Each of you, if he will, is a teacher, although not of another, yet of himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:204
verses.text: Teach thyself first.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:205
verses.text: If thou teachest to observe all things whatsoever He commanded, even by this means thou wilt have many emulating thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:206
verses.text: For as a lamp, when it is shining, is able to light ten thousand others, but being extinguished will not give light even to itself, nor can it lighten other lamps; so also in the case of a pure life, if the light that is in us be shining, we shall make both disciples and teachers numberless, being set before them as a pattern to copy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:207
verses.text: For neither will the words proceeding from me be able so to benefit the hearers, as your life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:208
verses.text: For let a man, tell me, be dear to God, and shining in virtue, and having a wife; (for it is possible for a man having a wife and children and servants and friends to please God;) will he not be able much more than I to benefit them all? For me they will hear once or twice in a month, or not even once, and even though they have kept what they have heard as far as the threshold of the Church, they presently let it drop away from them: but seeing the life of that man constantly, they receive great advantage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:209
verses.text: For when being insulted he insults not again, does he not almost infix and engrave upon the soul of the insulter the reverence of his meekness?
