And though he does not immediately confess the benefit, being ashamed from anger, or put to confusion, yet nevertheless he immediately is made sensible of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:210
verses.text: And it is impossible for a man that is insolent, though he be a very beast, to associate with one who is patient of evil, without going away much benefited.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:211
verses.text: For although we do not what is good, we however all praise it and admire it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:212
verses.text: Again, the wife, if she see her husband gentle, being always with him receives great advantage, and the child also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:213
verses.text: It is therefore in the power of every one to be a teacher.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:214
verses.text: For he says, "Build each other up, even as also ye do".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:215
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:216
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:217
verses.text: ) For tell me, has any loss befallen the family? The wife is disturbed, as being weaker, and more extravagant, and fond of ornament; the man if he be a philosopher, and a derider of loss, both consoles her, and persuades her to bear it with fortitude.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:218
verses.text: Tell me, then, will he not benefit her much more than our words? For it is easy to talk, but to act, when we are reduced to the necessity, is in every way difficult.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:219
verses.text: On this account human nature is wont rather to be regulated by deeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:220
verses.text: And such is the superiority of virtue, that even a slave often benefits a whole family together with the master.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:221
verses.text: For not in vain, nor without reason, does Paul constantly command them to practice virtue, and to be obedient to their master, not so much regarding the service of their masters, as that the word of God and the doctrine be not blasphemed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:222
verses.text: But when it is not blasphemed, it will soon also be admired.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:223
verses.text: And I know of many families, that they have greatly benefited by the virtue of their slaves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:224
verses.text: But if a servant placed under authority can improve his master, much more can the master his servants.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:225
verses.text: Divide then with me, I beseech you, this ministry.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:226
verses.text: I address all generally, do you each individual privately and let each charge himself with the salvation of his neighbors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:227
verses.text: For that it becomes one to preside over those of his household in these matters, hear where Paul sends women for instruction; "And if they would learn anything, let them ask their own husbands at home" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:228
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:229
verses.text: ); and he does not lead them to the Teacher.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:230
verses.text: For as in the schools of learning, there are teachers even among the disciples, so also in the Church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:231
verses.text: For he wishes the Teacher not to be troubled by all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:232
verses.text: Wherefore? Because then there will be great advantages, not only that the labor will be light to the Teacher, but that each of the disciples also, having taken pains, is soon able to become a teacher, making this his concern.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:233
verses.text: For see how great a service the wife contributes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:234
verses.text: She keeps the house, and takes care of all things in the house, she presides over her handmaids, she clothes them with her own hands, she causes thee to be called the father of children, she delivers thee from brothels, she aids thee to live chastely, she puts a stop to the strong desire of nature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:235
verses.text: And do thou also benefit her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:236
verses.text: How? In spiritual things stretch forth thy hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:237
verses.text: Whatever useful things thou hast heard, these, like the swallows, bearing off in thy mouth, carry away and place them in the mouth of the mother and the young ones.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:238
verses.text: For how is it not absurd, in other things to think thyself worthy of the preeminence, and to occupy the place of the head, but in teaching to quit thy station.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:239
verses.text: The ruler ought not to excel the ruled in honors, so much as in virtues.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:240
verses.text: For this is the duty of a ruler, for the other is the part of the ruled, but this is the achievement of the ruler himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:241
verses.text: If thou enjoyest much honor, it is nothing to thee, for thou receivedst it from others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:242
verses.text: If thou shinest in much virtue, this is all thine own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:243
verses.text: Thou art the head of the woman, let then the head regulate the rest of the body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:244
verses.text: Dost thou not see that it is not so much above the rest of the body in situation, as in forethought, directing like a steersman the whole of it? For in the head are the eyes both of the body, and of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:245
verses.text: Hence flows to them both the faculty of seeing, and the power of directing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:246
verses.text: And the rest of the body is appointed for service, but this is set to command.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:247
verses.text: All the senses have thence their origin and their source.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:248
verses.text: Thence are sent forth the organs of speech, the power of seeing, and of smelling, and all touch.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:249
verses.text: For thence is derived the root of the nerves and of the bones.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:250
verses.text: Seest thou not that it is superior in forethought more than in honor? So let us rule the women; let us surpass them, not by seeking greater honor from them, but by their being more benefited by us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:251
verses.text: I have shown that they afford us no little benefit, but if we are willing to make them a return in spiritual things, we surpass them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:252
verses.text: For it is not possible in bodily things to offer an equivalent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:253
verses.text: For what? dost thou contribute much wealth? but it is she who preserves it, and this care of hers is an equivalent, and thus there is need of her, because many, who had great possessions, have lost all because they had not one to take care of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:254
verses.text: But as for the children, you both communicate, and the benefit from each is equal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:255
verses.text: She indeed in these things rather has the more laborious service, always bearing the offspring, and being afflicted with the pains of childbirth; so that in spiritual things only wilt thou be able to surpass her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:256
verses.text: Let us not therefore regard how we shall have wealth, but how we shall present with confidence to God the souls with which we are entrusted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:257
verses.text: For by regulating them we shall also most highly benefit ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:258
verses.text: For he who teaches another, although he does nothing else, yet in speaking is affected with compunction, when he sees himself responsible for those things, on account of which he reproves others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 2 Thessalonians 6:259
verses.text: Since therefore we benefit both ourselves and them, and through them the household, and this is preëminently pleasing to God; let us not be weary of taking care both of our own souls and of those who minister to us, that for all we may receive a recompense, and with much riches may arrive at the holy City our mother, the Jerusalem that is above, from which God grant that we may never fall, but that having shone in the most excellent course of life, we may be thought worthy with much confidence to see our Lord Jesus Christ; with whom to the Father, together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, power, and honor, now and ever, and world without end, Amen.
